fr.univrennes1.cri.jtacl.core.monitor
Class Probe

java.lang.Object
  fr.univrennes1.cri.jtacl.core.monitor.Probe

public class Probe
extends java.lang.Object

This class describes a probe. A 'probe' is like an IP packet with several informations added to describe what we want to check over the network.
By example, a probe can be a range of ip addresses, a range of ports, a range of protocols.
A probe is also associated to a ProbesTracker which has the responsibility to track probes and has a ProbeResults which stores the result of the probing.

Author:
Patrick Lamaiziere

Constructor Detail

Probe

protected Probe()
Creates a new raw Probe probe. Equipments must not call this constructor, instead use newChild() or newInstance() to get a new probe.

Probe

public Probe(ProbesTracker probesTracker,
             IPNet sourceAddress,
             IPNet destinationAddress,
             ProbeRequest request)
Creates a new Probe root probe. The TimeToLive is set to its default value (32).

Parameters:
probesTracker - ProbesTracker tracker associated with this probe and its children.
sourceAddress - the IPNet source IP address of the probe.
destinationAddress - the IPNet destination IP address of the probe.
request - the ProbeRequest associated to this probe.

Probe

public Probe(ProbesTracker probesTracker,
             IPNet sourceAddress,
             IPNet destinationAddress,
             ProbeRequest request,
             int timeToLive)
Creates a new Probe root probe.

Parameters:
probesTracker - a ProbesTracker tracker to be associated with this probe and its children.
sourceAddress - the IPNet source IP address of the probe.
destinationAddress - the IPNet destination IP address of the probe.
request - the ProbeRequest associated to this probe. *
timeToLive - the TimeToLive of the probe.

getUid

public int getUid()
Returns the unique identifier number (uid) of this Probe probe.
Uid starts at zero and is incremented each time a probe is created. This is used to identify and track probes.

Returns:
the Uid of this Probe

getTimeToLive

public int getTimeToLive()
Returns the TimeToLive (TTL) of this probe. The TTL is decremented on each equipment and is used to prevent loop, as the TTL field in an IP packet.

Returns:
the TimeToLive of this probe.

public void setTimeToLive(int ttl)
Sets the TimeToLive of this probe.

Parameters:
ttl - TimeToLive.

Checks if this probe is alive.

Returns:
true if the TimeToLive of this probe is greater than 0.

newChild

public Probe newChild()
Creates a new Probe] probe, child of this probe. The tracker and the position are not shared and the newly created probe is added to the list of the children of this probe.

Returns:
the created probe.

newInstance

public Probe newInstance()
Creates a new Probe copy of this probe. The tracker is not shared and the position is initialized by a copy of the position of this probe. The list of the children is copied too.

Returns:
the created probe.

hasChildren

public boolean hasChildren()
Checks if this Probe probe has some children probes.

Returns:
true if this Probe probe has some children probes.

path

public java.lang.String path()
Returns a String representation of the path followed by this probe and its ancestors

Returns:
a String representation of the path followed by this probe and its ancestors.

getParentProbes

public ProbesList getParentProbes()
Returns all the parent probes of this Probe probe. Parents are returned in the order root parent - nearest parent.

Returns:
a ProbesList list containing the parent probes. The list could be empty but not null.

getPositions

public ProbePositions getPositions()
Returns all the positions of this Probe probe and its ancestors.

Returns:
a ProbePositions list containing the positions. The list could be empty but not null.

getParentsPositions

public ProbePositions getParentsPositions()
Returns all the positions of the ancestors of this Probe probe.

Returns:
a ProbePositions list containing the positions. The list could be empty but not null.

Returns a String representation of getPositions(). (ie the path followed by the probe.)

Returns:
a String representation of getPositions().

Parameters:
message - informational message.
